mobs.long_desc: A stone statue of a Large Knight stands guard.
mobs.desc: Much larger than life, this statue is realistic beyond human skill. Mismatched, ill-fitting, magically enhanced armor shows that this knight is a contemporary of this realm, which has been overwhelmed by a demonic invasion and where armor is no longer crafted, but must be captured.  A symbol of the here and now, the knight wears a grimly determined look, as if knowing that danger and safety are meaningless terms in this world.

objects.ground: A small shiny metalic object lies here.
A very realistic stuffed mist beast stands in a corner, looking fierce.

extras.text: A lupine looking beast endemic to the Blue Fog Trail, this is a remarkably large speciman standing almost waist high to a human.  This particular beast is very dear to the hearts of the BoP, partly because it played a significant part in their history, but more importantly because a divinely inspired taxidermist built a still into the beast's carcass.  The output from the still can be obtained from the left front nipple, where a small spigot has been tastefully imbedded.  Traditionally the BoP mentor has been in charge of caring for the still.

objects.ground: A large, faceted marble fountain stands here spilling fresh water.

extras.text: The inscription reads: "What was shall be again."

This large, carved marble statue dominates the center of this courtyard. There is a small statue of a knight in the middle, with the water of the fountain gushing out from beneath the hooves of the great knight's steed.  The knight has his head fixed, looking forwards into the future, his gaze following his extended blade pointing fourth.  Just under where the water spills from the darkened marble there is a small insignia written on a plaque.

rooms.name: Before an Old Monastery
rooms.description: The path leads though a slightly grassy area on the flat clifftop.  The crashing of waves can be heard to the east and the green sea stretches out to the horizon. The path leads back against the hills slightly so the monastery is protected on three sides by the high, sheer limestone cliffs. The building is modestly constructed, carved in part from the rock itself, looks very old and unchanged except for what appears to be a new solid door of metal and wood.

North.description: The heavy wooden door is new looking and very sturdily made. It's bordered with metal reinforcements and accoutrements. There is a carving in the center of the door.

extras.text: The heavy wooden door is new looking and very sturdily made. It's bordered with metal reinforcements and accoutrements. There is a carving in the center of the door.
The carving is a circle composed of five circles linked together. In the center of the five circles is carved the guild icon.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: This is a large open courtyard that serves as both an entrance and staging area.  Two sides of this rectangular area, house unknown and boarded up rooms. The very center has a small very neat garden.  There is a door located just off the dirt and grass of the courtyard under an awned walkway that laps the perimeter.

North.description: A sturdy door leads into the castle.

South.description: The heavy wooden door is new looking and very sturdily made. It's bordered with metal reinforcements and accoutrements. There is a carving in the center of the door.

extras.text: The heavy wooden door is new looking and very sturdily made. It's bordered with metal reinforcements and accoutrements. There is a carving in the center of the door.
The carving is a circle composed of five circles linked together. In the center of the five circles is carved the guild icon.

rooms.name: Pandor Gathering Room
rooms.description: This room is dominated by a huge round table surrounded by chairs.  Rugs and tapestries adorn the walls and floor.  Behind some of the tapestries there are the outlines of arches.  Smaller groupings of chairs separated by small tables are placed around the room's perimeter.  Wall sconces and a large oil lamp chandelier provide the light. A simple wooden door stands to the north, and a much sturdier one to the south.

North.description: A simple door stands in the north wall.

South.description: A sturdy door stands in the south wall.

extras.text: The tapestry depicts a scene of Paladins and Priests doing battle with a demon lord.  Off to one side is a ranger fighting an ice dragon.
The table is very old, of oaken wood, with worn edges and many scratches. It is carved in the center with the same design seen on the door.
The chair is deeply padded and invites you to relax in it.

rooms.name: The Pandor Rec Room
rooms.description: This large chamber, well-crafted of stone, is a taxidermist's nightmare.  An entire mist beast with a miner's pick still buried in its skull sits in the southeast corner. Over a cavernous stone fireplace are the mounted heads of a wyvern, a griffin, and an ice couatl, all arranged around a large oil painting of the original Circle of Five. A large, comfortable-looking couch upholstered in crimson demon skin stands before the fireplace. Scatter rugs all over the floor are the well-cured hides of bears, wolves, and cougars. Some lesser horrors are mounted at head height over the waist high bookshelves along the east and south walls. The floor to ceiling windows on the north give a stunning view of the ocean, and provide light in the daytime.  At night the room is lit as desired by wall sconces and table lamps on the three small tables placed haphazardly about the room. The only visible exit stands to the south.
